alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 02 at 3:14AM CDT until August 02 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: .Thunderstorms from southern Iowa through northern Missouri may move slowly eastward into the area this morning. Extremely high atmospheric moisture levels will support very heavy rainfall. Although the area is in a drought, rainfall rates of 2-3 inches per hour could occur and exceed the ability of the ground to soak up the rain. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... The Flood Watch continues for * A portion of northeast Missouri, including the following areas, Clark and Scotland. * Until 10 AM CDT this morning * WHEN...From 11 PM CDT this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
